title: The distressed pilgrim, who being in much misery, he serves the Lord most faitfully [sic]: and repenteth for the things are past, and prayes for a heavenly place at last. The tune is, Who can blame my vvoe; or, I am a jovial batchelor.
publicationStmtPublisher: Printed for W. Thackeray, T. Passenger, and W. Whitwood.,
